wiki.content:
taj at his best
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.

track.name: Going Up To The Country, Paint My Mailbox Blue
comments: Taj must be one of the most talented let-downs in all Blues history. He was so good at every tstyle he tried that he spent too long flitting from one thing to another rather than setteling into one style and OWNING it. He's always just a visitor glossing over the surface of everything he does.
one of the best blues boys of all time!
Watch him at Fillmore west "70s..To good

I am glad a new friend had this on his recently listened to songs, as i have a personal connection due to a very good woman who had more history with Taj .I still think about their great loss together.
i have to smile when i hear this...Taj's mom is from SC!! Saw him in Charleston SC great show.
Long time since moving to the Canyon, but still going strong. I likeTaj very much.
Gosh I'm so depressed, gotta paint that mailbox blue
I saw Taj many decades ago, God he was good, out of interest, his son plays in a New Zealand Reggae/dub band called Rhombus, check them out if you like that type of thing.
Jules Holland, god bless you for introducing me to this man!
I'm seeing things and felt the smell
i'm gonna buy some paint and i'm gonna paint that mailbox
Taj on a Saturday night....cold beer, loose women...the blues

Friends in good music please join me on myspace : http://www.myspace.com/epi_geeinc , hope to see you there.

- EPG
